intro: Leptocarpus tenellus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or shingle soils along the shorelines, thriving in saline and well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, appearing in late winter to spring. Leptocarpus tenellus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
